intro: Stylidium tylosum, commonly known as the velvetleaf stiltgrass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Haemodoraceae, characterized by its distinctive, often bright-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as swamps and marshes. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often prostrate or ascending. The flowers are usually clustered in spikes and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
